The significance of this legislation for Kentucky cannot be overstated: 
‚Ä¢ $5B for infrastructure projects, including billions for our roads, bridges, airports & disaster mitigation
‚Ä¢ $400M for public transit
‚Ä¢ $100M for broadband internet
‚Ä¢ $647M for clean drinking water

The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act, which @POTUS just signed into law, will put Kentuckians to work to finally bring our Commonwealth‚Äôs roads, bridges, and technical capabilities into the 21st century.
It‚Äôs official. Kentucky is getting critically needed and long-overdue help, not just for our dire infrastructure needs, but for working families in all 120 counties.

One done. One to go.

This major accomplishment comes just 11 months into the Biden presidency, and we aren‚Äôt stopping here. Soon we will also enact the #BuildBackBetter Act, the greatest investment in the American people since the New Deal.

After years and years of failed attempts, we are enacting a once-in-a-generation infrastructure package. This bipartisan legislation will create millions of jobs‚Äîinvesting in roads, bridges, public transit, clean drinking water, broadband, climate resiliency, and more.

Our nation has reached an inflection point. Today‚Äôs House vote on the #BuildBackBetter Act is our opportunity to overhaul and reimagine sectors of our economy and society so that everyone ‚Äì not just those at the top ‚Äì get a fair shot at the American dream.

When we invest in Americans' health, our children's futures, and expanded opportunities for all ‚Äì we create a stronger, more prosperous future for our nation. A future where everyone has a shot at the American dream.

That‚Äôs what the #BuildBackBetter Act is all about.
